org.zaproxy.zap.common

Class VersionedAbstractParam

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.parosproxy.paros.common.AbstractParam
      • org.zaproxy.zap.common.VersionedAbstractParam
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable

    public abstract class VersionedAbstractParam
extends AbstractParam
    A versioned AbstractParam.

    A version number is saved in the configuration file to keep track of changes between releases, in case changes/updates are needed.

    Since:
    2.4.0
    See Also:
    AbstractParam

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected static int ERROR_READING_CONFIG_VERSION
      A dummy version number used at runtime to indicate that an error occurred while reading the version from the file.
      protected static int NO_CONFIG_VERSION
      A dummy version number used at runtime to indicate that the configurations were never persisted.
      protected static String VERSION_ATTRIBUTE
      The key to read/write the version of the configurations, as an attribute.

    • Field Detail

      • VERSION_ATTRIBUTE

        protected static final String VERSION_ATTRIBUTE
        The key to read/write the version of the configurations, as an attribute. It should be used to compose the key for the configurations node.
        See Also:
        getConfigVersionKey(), Constant Field Values

        protected static final int NO_CONFIG_VERSION
        A dummy version number used at runtime to indicate that the configurations were never persisted.
        See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • parse

        protected void parse()
        Parses the file for configurations.

        Calls updateConfigFile() followed by parseImpl().

        Note: It shouldn't be overridden in normal conditions.

        Specified by:
        parse in class AbstractParam
        See Also:
        AbstractParam.getConfig()

      • parseImpl

        protected abstract void parseImpl()
        Parses the file for configurations.

        Called after checking and updating, if necessary, the configurations in the file.

      • updateConfigFile

        protected void updateConfigFile()
        Updates the configurations in the file, if needed.

        The following steps are made:

        1. Read the version of the configurations that are in the file, by calling readConfigFileVersion();
        2. Check if the version read is the latest version, by calling isLatestConfigVersion(int);
        3. If it's not at the latest version, update the configurations, by calling updateConfigsFromVersion(int).

        Note: It shouldn't be overridden in normal conditions.

        See Also:
        readConfigFileVersion(), isLatestConfigVersion(int), updateConfigsFromVersion(int)

      • readConfigFileVersion

        protected int readConfigFileVersion()
        Reads the version number from the configuration file, using the key returned by getConfigVersionKey().

        Note: It shouldn't be overridden in normal conditions.

        Returns:
        the version number read, or NO_CONFIG_VERSION if no version was found or ERROR_READING_CONFIG_VERSION if an error occurred while reading the version
        See Also:
        NO_CONFIG_VERSION, ERROR_READING_CONFIG_VERSION, getConfigVersionKey()

      • getConfigVersionKey

        protected abstract String getConfigVersionKey()
        Returns the key to read/write the version of the configurations.

        For example:

         BASE_KEY + VERSION_ATTRIBUTE
        Returns:
        the key to read/write the version
        See Also:
        VERSION_ATTRIBUTE

      • isLatestConfigVersion

        protected boolean isLatestConfigVersion(int version)
        Tells whether or not the given version number is the latest version, that is, is the same version number as the version of the running code.

        Note: It shouldn't be overridden in normal conditions.

        Parameters:
        version - the version that will be checked
        Returns:
        true if the given version is the latest version, false otherwise
        See Also:
        getCurrentVersion(), updateConfigFile()

      • getCurrentVersion

        protected abstract int getCurrentVersion()
        Returns the current version of the configurations, that is, the version of running code.

        The version number should be a positive integer, incremented (by one) for change(s) done between releases. It only needs to be incremented for configuration changes (i.e. not releases of the add-on).

        Returns:
        the current version of the configurations

      • updateConfigsFromVersion

        protected void updateConfigsFromVersion(int fileVersion)
        Called when the configuration version in the file is different than the version of the running code.

        If the given fileVersion is:

        • < current version - expected case, the configurations are changed/updated to the current version by calling the method updateConfigsImpl(int). After calling the method the version in the configuration file is updated to the current version.
        • > current version - no changes/updates are made, the method logs a warn and returns;
        • NO_CONFIG_VERSION - only the current version is written to the configuration file (Note: the method updateConfigsImpl(int) is still called);
        • ERROR_READING_CONFIG_VERSION - no changes/updates are made, the method logs a warn and returns.

        Note: It shouldn't be overridden in normal conditions.

        Parameters:
        fileVersion - the version of the configurations in the file
        See Also:
        getCurrentVersion(), NO_CONFIG_VERSION, ERROR_READING_CONFIG_VERSION, updateConfigsImpl(int), updateConfigFile()

      • updateConfigsImpl

        protected abstract void updateConfigsImpl(int fileVersion)
        Called when the configuration version in the file is different than the version of the running code.

        Any required configuration changes/updates should be added to this method. For example: 

         switch (fileVersion) {
 case NO_CONFIG_VERSION:
     // No updates/changes needed, the configurations were not previously persisted
     // and the current version is already written at the end of the previous method.
     break;
 case 1:
    // Change the type of option X
    ...
    break; // if previous changes are required for following versions the break statement 
           // would be removed to achieve an incremental update
 case 2:
    // Remove option Y
    ...
 }
        Parameters:
        fileVersion - the version of the configurations in the file
